page.title: 12PARTRIDGE GREEN "MONUMENT"
page.content: THE HORSE'S GRAVE is a well known monument in Partridge Green but little is known about it. Most old people are familiar with it.It's owner was an early resident of SHERMANBURY GRANGE and a member of the COLVIN family.The horse was in the CAVALRY OF ENGLAND in the GREAT WAR.The horse's name was HOPIT and he died on JAN.7TH 1927 at the incredible age of 21.HOPIT served as a CHARGER in the GREAT WAR. This is the writing on his TOMBSTONE:- YPRES 1915 HOPIT CAMBRAI 1917 SOMME 1916 - 1918 ROSLERS 1918 ARRAS 1917 PURSUIT TO MONS 1918 BG BY POP OF DAM BY NOBLE CHIEFTAN 1906 SERVED THROUGHOUT THE GREAT WAR A CHARGER TO LIEUTENTENT JOHN FORRESTER COLVIN OF QUEENS ROYAL LANCERS. 2ND.NOV.1914 - 11TH.NOV.1918 ARMY OF OCCUPATION OF THE RHINE.
